trans-unit.source: Creates the structure of two structures

seg-source.mrk: Creates the structure of two structures

target.mrk: Creates the structure of two structures

trans-unit.source: The structure that contains the first source data.

seg-source.mrk: The structure that contains the first source data.

target.mrk: The structure that contains the first source data.

trans-unit.source: The structure that contains the second source data.

seg-source.mrk: The structure that contains the second source data.

target.mrk: The structure that contains the second source data.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The string representing the final structure (same as for the DllStructCreate() function).

seg-source.mrk: The string representing the final structure (same as for the DllStructCreate() function).

target.mrk: The string representing the final structure (same as for the DllStructCreate() function).

trans-unit.source: "byte[n]" structure that contains the union data of the $tStruct1 and $tStruct2.

seg-source.mrk: "byte[n]" structure that contains the union data of the $tStruct1 and $tStruct2.

target.mrk: "byte[n]" structure that contains the union data of the $tStruct1 and $tStruct2.

trans-unit.source: Important, you have to take into account the alignments of the structures. For example, "byte" & "dword" is

seg-source.mrk: Important, you have to take into account the alignments of the structures.

target.mrk: Important, you have to take into account the alignments of the structures.

trans-unit.source: not equivalent to "byte;dword", but equivalent to "align 1;byte;dword".

seg-source.mrk: not equivalent to "byte;dword", but equivalent to "align 1;byte;dword".

target.mrk: not equivalent to "byte;dword", but equivalent to "align 1;byte;dword".
